node.title: Teen who stabbed woman in daylight once chased 'annoying' pet cat with an axe, court hears
node.alt: The outside of the County Court of Victoria building.
node.description: A Melbourne teenager who claims he has no memory of stabbing a woman in the back in broad daylight has been thrown in youth detention over the brazen attack, as it emerged that he once tried to kill a cat with an axe.
node.content: ["A Melbourne teenager who claims he has no memory of stabbing a woman in the back in broad daylight has been thrown in youth detention over the brazen attack, as it emerged that he once tried to kill a cat with an axe.", "Dimitri Evangelou, 19, today appeared in the County Court of Victoria, where he was ordered to spend three years in a youth justice centre over the terrifying attack on a stranger at Gowanbrae, in Melbourne's north-west, in 2020.", "But with time served Evangelou, who has been in custody since September last year, will be eligible for release in just under two years.", "Judge Douglas Trapnell today told the court that the 19-year-old, who pleaded guilty to recklessly causing serious injury, cannot remember attacking the woman or being arrested over the crime.\u00a0", "\"You violently attacked an alone, defenceless woman with a knife \u2026 who did not to provoke you, in a public place, in broad daylight, for no apparent reason,\" the judge said.", "The court heard that when asked about the crime by a psychiatric expert, Evangelou was unable to shed any light on his actions.", "\"I just can't explain it \u2026 it's so not me,\" he said.", "In September 2020, Evangelou's victim, a 21-year-old woman, was walking home after having coffee when she saw him walking towards her along the footpath of the Gowanbrae Community Centre.", "They made eye contact, but she kept walking before seeing him again at the nearby playground.", "Minutes later, Evangelou attacked the woman.\u00a0", "\"You grabbed her but did not have a tight hold of her,\"\u00a0the judge said.", "He fled when she started screaming, but left behind his phone which was seized by police.", "Investigators later found a pocket knife and blood-stained clothing at Evangelou's home, but he denied stabbing the woman.\u00a0", "The court heard that Evangelou, who has no history of violence, may have been in the early stages of a psychotic illness.", "Judge Trapnell today aired the details of Evangelou's psychiatric report which revealed that he had significant behavioural problems as a child including anger management issues.", "Evangelou is currently being held in protection at an adult prison, but on today's sentence, will be moved to a youth justice centre.", "He has already served 454 days in custody."]
